page.title: 04SMUGGLERS INN AT ST.ERTH
page.content: The old part of the pub dates back to the 16th century.It is a protected building which means it can't be altered.It was added to in the 18th century and the new part of the pub is {5}years old. The Smugglers was originally called the Calais because the road outside is called Calais Road.Then the name was changed to the Victoria Inn. It is now called the Smugglers because of the smuggling family once said to have lived there. The Carter family were great smugglers.Legend says one of them was hung in the front room. There is a mysterious presence in the pub and the owner has seen a{black shape}pass through a closed door. On another occasion a glass was seen to jump from a shelf and bounce across the bar.
